remarks: Lemma for ~ lspprat .  Negating the assumption on ` y ` , we arrive close to the desired conclusion.  (Contributed by NM, 29-Aug-2014.)
statement:
lspprat.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lspprat.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` W ) $.
lspprat.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` W ) $.
lspprat.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
lspprat.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. S ) $.
lspprat.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
lspprat.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. V ) $.
lspprat.p $e |- ( ph -> U C. ( N ` { X , Y } ) ) $.
lsppratlem6.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` W ) $.
lsppratlem6 $p |- ( ph -> ( x e. ( U \ { .0. } ) -> U = ( N ` { x } ) ) ) $.
